newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai B shares end down on correction.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai B shares end down on correction.

text.p: Shanghai's B shares ended down on Tuesday on a technical correction triggered by selling in stocks expected to issue poor 1996 results, brokers said.
The B index fell 0.973 points or 1.11 percent to 86.557 points on volume of 44.874 million shares worth $26.931 million, compared with $36.359 million yuan on Monday.
Brokers said selling in shares expected to post poor 1996 results pulled the index down, but market sentiment is still good following the solid gains of the past few sessions.
Of 43 B share companies, two-thirds have yet to issue their 1996 results with April 30 deadline approaching.
Huaxin Cement 1996 net profits plunged 63.87 percent, the company statement said on Tuesday.
Its poor result led to selling in other stocks expected to issue poor results for 1996, brokers said.
Huaxin was the second biggest loser on unwinding selling, slipping $0.022 or 7.43 percent to $0.274 on volume of 1.9 million shares.
"Active bargain-hunting prevented the index from losing further," one broker said. "Most investors believe that the market can see the index hitting 100 points in the near future."
Brokers said they expected support around 85 points.
All 43 B shares traded, with 32 down, two flat and nine up.
Shanghai Automation Instrument was the biggest loser on expectations of unpromising results, tumbling $0.020 or 7.93 percent to $0.232 on volume of 1.1 million shares.
Shanghai Refrigerator Compressor was the most actively traded on talk of possible lower-than-expected results, slipping $0.020 or 2.91 percent to $0.666 on volume of 3.8 million shares.
But the Shanghai A share index continued to rise on bullish sentiment, brokers said.
The index put on 4.096 points or 0.29 percent to 1,428.202 points on volume of 964.9 million shares worth 11.7 billion yuan.
The SSE30 index edged up 1.037 points or 0.03 percent to 3,683.373 points.
Shanghai Video & Audio Electronics was the star after its recently-announced financial restructuring, up 1.28 yuan or 10.03 percent to 14.03 yuan on volume of 11.8 million shares.
